content.rendered:
Now you can easily take control of your Admin Bar, Dashboard, Widgets, Excerpt, RSS feeds and more!

This week we announced our first public plugin that runs on Piklist: WordPress Helpers, available now at WordPress.org.  We designed WordPress Helpers to be the missing settings page for WordPress.

Why do you need WordPress Helpers? Well, if you answer YES to any of these questions, then WordPress Helpers is for you:

  • Are you tired of seeing “Jabber” in your user profile?
  • Do you question why anyone would use the Calendar widget?
  • Is your WordPress Dashboard cluttered?
  • Would you love to change “Howdy”?
  • Do you want more control of WordPress?

If you’re still not convinced you’ll want to read the review of WordPress Helpers on WPMU.org.

Piklist Checker

This plugin also includes the first version of our Piklist Checker. If you’re developing plugins with Piklist, check out why you need to use the  Piklist Checker.
